meanings.sent1: She wore a fake smile to hide her sadness.
meanings.sent2: The fake diamond looked real from a distance.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sell a fake painting, but no one believed it was real.
meanings.sent4: The fake promises he made left her heartbroken.
meanings.sent5: The fake designer bag was quickly identified by the experts.

meanings.sent1: He would often fake being sick to skip school.
meanings.sent2: The magician used sleight of hand to fake the disappearance of the coin.
meanings.sent3: She decided to fake a fall to get attention, but it didn't go as planned.
meanings.sent4: The actor had to fake his emotions for the scene to look realistic.
meanings.sent5: The student tried to fake his handwriting to avoid getting caught.

meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone they are not
meanings.sent1: The spy was a master of disguise, a true fake.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a fake pretending to be a doctor.
meanings.sent3: The fake prince turned out to be a common thief in disguise.
meanings.sent4: Beneath the mask, the fake revealed his true identity.
meanings.sent5: The imposter was exposed as a fake during the investigation.
